item.title: Report E-2024090073
item.description:
Report E-2024090073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 21, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of ink was crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. LE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and waste were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090089
item.description:
Report E-2024090089

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-12
  • City: SEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver stopped for the night and was doing his post trip inspection he noticed that there were some liquid dripping on the trailer tires. The driver then put down some absorbent and call our emergency number. The team was dispatched to address the leaking container. The team showed up and Identified the container that was leaking. They needed to get extra equipment out there to gain better access to the drum so they stopped the leak and requested further equipment. The equipment showed up by 0600 on 8/13/24 and they then gained access to the container cleaning any left over residue and disposing of the absorbent appropriately. The damaged drum was placed into a salvage drum and rescued in the trailer for shipment. The clean up was completed by 0800.

item.title: Report E-2024090098
item.description:
Report E-2024090098

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS of a 100-gallon release of UN2810, Proxel TN Preservative. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to assist with cleanup. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 20ft-by-20ft area of the concrete dock trailer floor and estimated that one hundred (100) gallons of material was released due to a forklift damaging one (1) plastic tote. First Call Environmental neutralized the impacted area, deployed absorbents, and cleaned the released material. The damaged tote and recovered material were placed into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024090065
item.description:
Report E-2024090065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-06T09:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: PAINESVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While in transit the driver noticed material on the side of his tank and pulled off and inspected the trailer 1030et. He discovered the the seal on the manhole was not seating properly and the material was seeping out onto the tank. They sent out a new tank and a temporary containment so that the material could be safely transferred. The new tank showed up at 1330et and the temporary containment arrived at 1600et. They then set up the containment and transferred the material into the new tank. The material that got on the side of the tank was cleaned off and put into a salvage drum for proper disposal. The transfer and break down of the containment took about an hour and they were back on the road by 1700et.

item.title: Report E-2024090007
item.description:
Report E-2024090007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: UPPER SANDSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3267 Sika FerroGard 903 release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete lot below. The pail was crushed as a result of stacking. The impacted area was cleaned with pads and granular absorbents. The damaged pail and all cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090017
item.description:
Report E-2024090017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 27, 2024, at 1806 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Hamilton, Ohio regarding the release of Houghto-Etch AX-2040. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of Houghto-Etch AX-2040 (UN2817, Ammonium Hydrogendiflouride Solution, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 55-gallon DF. The release was caused by a puncture and impacted a 2ft x 1ft area of concrete. The damaged drum was placed in an 85-gallon DF overpack, absorbents and neutralizer were then used to clean the release. All waste was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, and (1) 85-gallon DF overpack then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080768
item.description:
Report E-2024080768

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-24
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) ounces of material released from two (2) 1-quart metal cans due to crushed freight due to improper preparation for transit that impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents and damaged pails into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080751
item.description:
Report E-2024080751

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) ounces of material released impacting the trailer floor from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum along with impacted cardboard and the damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
